result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Dean Johnson

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Nieskes  DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus   DF:  Anthony Dean Johnson did not appear. Case called at 2:23 p.m. Atty Firkus does not know where defendant is. ADA Nieskes requesting a warrant with a $500 purge condition. Court will authorize warrant with a $500 purge condition.
To RMW from Atty Firkus requesting to appear via phone for 12-23-15 PTC. Approved by RMW. Faxed to PD by JA.  hml

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus appears via phone. Atty Joe Caton appears in person on behalf of Atty Firkus  DF:  Anthony Dean Johnson appeared. Case called at 9:53 a.m. ADA Nieskes states defendant missed a court date 8 days ago.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

CO: RMW,  CLERK: Evenson ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus DF:  Anthony Dean Johnson did not appear. Case called at 8:43. Set for a PTC.Off record discussions. ADA Nieskes requests to set another PTC date.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:45 am.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Alissa P. or General Sams in Somerset.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Anthony Dean Johnson appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial. ADA Nieskes requests $1500.00 CB, Atty Kucinski argues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:45 am.
